S:log-item.D:comment:
DERBY-4621: Invalid conversion from Timestamp to String when calling setTimestamp() with Calendar
Two changes to fix the wrong time and to harmonize the format between the methods that take a Calendar argument and those that don't:
1) Use 24-hour clock when converting the time component to a string
2) Add a decimal point and a single zero if the nanosecond component of a Timestamp is zero
